subject: Ethics
title: Proportionality in Warfare
description: A quick win: understand Proportionality in Warfare.

hook.text: A sniper fires from a hospital rooftop. Can you bomb the entire hospital to stop one shooter?

buildup.text: Proportionality says military force must match the threat. You can't nuke a village to catch one spy.

discovery.text: Commanders must weigh expected military advantage against anticipated civilian harm before every strike.

twist.text: In practice, this math is impossible. How do you measure one strategic target against twelve dead children?

climax.text: Critics say proportionality is a fig leafâ€”it sounds moral but lets militaries justify almost anything.

punchline.text: The math of war never adds up. People aren't numbers.

quiz.question: What does proportionality require of military commanders?
options: They must use only non-lethal weapons in all situations
They must never cause any civilian casualties under any circumstances
They must weigh expected military advantage against anticipated civilian harm
